name: COPA (Choice of Plausible Alternatives)
summary:

A dataset for evaluating commonsense causal reasoning through multiple-choice questions.
size: 1,000 questions (500 development, 500 test); each with 2 answer options.
notes: Each COPA item presents a premise and asks for either a cause or an effect, with two plausible alternatives. The dataset is balanced to avoid superficial cues and has been included in the SuperGLUE benchmark. Human performance is approximately 100%.
